capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: The role requires working in challenging outdoor conditions and dealing with unexpected situations, necessitating resilience and courage.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Field Officers must adhere to environmental laws and regulations, demonstrating integrity in their work.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: The ability to work independently or with minimal supervision is crucial, highlighting the need for self-management.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Respecting diverse backgrounds is essential in a role that serves the community and works towards the conservation of natural and cultural heritage.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Field Officers are expected to efficiently complete tasks such as maintenance, pest control, and fire management to achieve conservation goals.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role involves managing a variety of tasks in changing conditions, requiring effective planning and prioritization.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Field Officers must address and solve problems encountered during conservation and maintenance activities.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Officers are responsible for their actions and the safe operation of equipment, emphasizing accountability.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication is vital for teamwork and interacting with the public during visitor enquiries.

capabilities.name: Commit to Customer Service
capabilities.description: Providing information and assistance to park visitors requires a commitment to customer service.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role involves working closely with team members and other stakeholders to achieve conservation goals.

capabilities.name: Influence and Negotiate
capabilities.description: May need to negotiate or influence others in compliance activities or when working with community groups.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: Operating and maintaining various types of plant and equipment requires basic technological proficiency.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Field Officers participate in projects related to conservation works and asset management, necessitating project management skills.

skills.name: Outdoor Work Proficiency
skills.description: Ability to perform physically demanding tasks in outdoor settings.

skills.name: Equipment Operation
skills.description: Skills in operating and maintaining various types of equipment and vehicles.

skills.name: Fire Management
skills.description: Knowledge and skills in fire management practices and firefighting.

skills.name: Teamwork
skills.description: Ability to work effectively as part of a team.

skills.name: Problem Solving
skills.description: Ability to identify and solve problems encountered in the field.

generalRole.title: Field Conservation Officer
generalRole.description: This role involves a combination of outdoor physical work, conservation efforts, and interaction with the public to maintain and improve park assets and natural heritage. It requires a blend of technical skills, environmental knowledge, and soft skills to effectively contribute to the conservation and management of natural parks.
